questions.text: Which of the following would you advise as the best approach to control arthropods?
questions.solution:
Environmental control is the best approach to control arthropods.

The principles of arthropod control include:

  • Environmental control - Best approach
  • Chemical control - Use of insecticides, pesticides, etc.
  • Biological control - Use of larvivorous fish like Gambusia
  • Genetic control
  • Newer methods -
    • Chemosterilants
    • Insect growth regulators
    • Sex attractants
  • Integrated approach involves usage of more than one modality of arthropod control

questions.text: Which of the following is the best method to control houseflies?
questions.solution:
The best method to control houseflies is environmental control by the elimination of breeding places.

They have shown resistance to a number of insecticides, including DDT.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an organo-phosphate insecticide?
questions.solution:
Dieldrin is an organo-chlorine insecticide. It is a broad-spectrum insecticide that acts as a contact, stomach, and inhalation poison.

Related Pearl: Insecticides

Contact poisons

  • Natural: Pyrethrum, rotenone, derris, nicotine, mineral oils
  • Synthetic:
    • Organo-chlorine compounds: DDT, methoxychlor, HCH, lindane, chlordane, heptachlor, dieldrin, aldrin, toxaphene, kepone, mirex.
    • Repellants: Benzyl benzoate, indalone, meta-diethyltoluamide, dimethyl phthalate, ethyl hexanediol.
    • Organo-phosphorus compounds: Chlorthion (aryl), diazinon (aryl), demethoate, malathion (alkyl), fenthion, parathion (aryl), trichlorfon (alkyl), runnel, abale, naled, chlorpyrifos, fenitrothion, dicapthon.
    • Carbamates: Carbaryl, dimetilan, propoxur, pyrolan.
    • Synthetic pyrethroids: Prothrin, resmethrin, bioresmethrin, permethrin, proparthin, tetramethrin
  • Stomach poisons: Paris green, sodium fluoride.
  • Fumigants: Hydrogen cyanide, methyl bromide, sulphur dioxide, carbon disulphide.
Specific Insecticides Comments
DDT (Dichloro-diphenyl-thrichloroethane) Insecticidal properties were discovered by Swiss scientist, Paul Muller. Most widely used insecticide. Attacks nerves of insects but doesn’t cause immediate death. White amorphous powder. Contains 70 – 80% of para-para isomers, which is the most active fraction of DDT. Has residual action up to 18 months. Used as a residual spray.Least toxic organo-chlorine compound.
HCH (hexachlorocyclo-hexane) Synthesized by Michael Faraday. Normal HCH contains 13 – 16% of gamma isomer. Gamma-HCH or lindane has 99% gamma isomer.Short residual action – 3 months.
Malathion Least toxicity of all organophosphorus compounds. Used as an ultra-low volume spray.
Fenthion Also called baytex. Used as a residual spray.
Pyrethrum Vegetable origin – Chrysanthemum cinerariafolium. Nerve poison and is excellent as a space spray.No residual action.Synergistic action with DDT as space spray.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an aryl organo-phosphate insecticide?
questions.solution:
Malathion is an alkyl organophosphate insecticide. It is used as an ultra-low volume spray in mosquito control.

Related Pearl: Insecticides

questions.text: Which of the following insecticides is least toxic to man?
questions.solution:
Among the given options, malathion is the least toxic to man. It is the least toxic organo-phosphate insecticide.

Contact poisons

questions.text: Which of the following is false about fenthion?

choices.text: It is used as a residual spray
It is used as a repellent

questions.solution:
Fenthion is not used as a repellant. A commonly used repellant is N,N-diethyl-m-toluamide (DEET) that is used for protection from mosquitoes and ticks.

Fenthion is a broad-spectrum insecticide that acts as both contact and stomach poison. It is used as a larvicide in mosquito control and also as a residual spray.

Related Pearl: Insecticides

Contact poisons

questions.text: Which of the following is false about pyrethrum?

choices.text: Residual action as good as DDT
Can be used synergistically with DDT

questions.solution:
Pyrethrum does not have a residual action like DDT or other synthetic insecticides. So, most space sprays contain pyrethrum and DDT for synergistic action.

Pyrethrum is a natural insecticide of vegetable origin. It is extracted from the flowers of Chrysanthemum cinerariafolium. It kills adult mosquitoes and other insects instantly on mere contact.

Contact poisons

questions.text: Which of the following cannot be used to describe pyrethrum?
questions.solution: Pyrethrum is not used as a residual spray. It is a contact and nerve poison that is also used as a space spray.

questions.text: Which of the following is a synthetic pyrethroid insecticide?
questions.solution:
Permethrin is a synthetic pyrethroid. Pyrethroids are synthetic insecticides, which are derived from naturally occurring pyrethrins. Pyrethroids modify the sodium channels in neuronal membranes and thereby disrupt the electrical signalling in the nervous system.

questions.text: Which of the following vectors has not shown resistance to synthetic pyrethroids, in a widespread manner in India yet?
questions.solution:
Sandflies (Phlebotomus) have not shown resistance to synthetic pyrethroids, in a widespread manner in India yet.

Related Pearl: Sandfly

  • They are also referred to as Phlebotomus.
  • They transmit diseases such as kala-azar (visceral leishmaniasis), Oriental sore, sandfly fever, and Oroya fever.
  • They are generally smaller than mosquitoes and are hairy insects.
  • They like to dwell in cracks and crevices in walls during the daytime. They are active during the night (nocturnal pests).
  • They do not fly for more than 50 yards.
  • They can be controlled by insecticides and also by proper sanitation.

Related Pearl: Insecticides

  • Synthetic:

questions.text: Which of the following best describes DDT?
questions.solution:
DDT is a contact poison that belongs to the organochlorine family. It has been widely used but a number of organisms have become resistant to its effects now.

Related Pearl: Insecticides

Contact poisons

  • Natural: Pyrethrum, rotenone, derris, nicotine, mineral oils
  • Synthetic:

questions.text: During a dengue outbreak, the municipal corporation plans a DDT spraying initiative. Which of the following is false about this insecticide?

choices.text: Para-para isomer is the most active fraction
It has residual action up to 18 months
It causes immediate death of insects

questions.solution:
DDT does not cause the immediate death of insects. It takes several hours for its action to be complete.

It contains 70 – 80% of para-para isomer that is the most active fraction of DDT. It acts on the nervous system of insects. The residual action of DDT may last as long as 18 months depending upon the treated surface.

Related Pearl: Insecticides

Contact poisons

  • Natural: Pyrethrum, rotenone, derris, nicotine, mineral oils
  • Synthetic:
    • Organo-chlorine compounds: DDT, methoxychlor, HCH, lindane, chlordane, heptachlor, dieldrin, aldrin, toxaphene, kepone, mirex.

    • Organo-phosphorus compounds: Chlorthion (aryl), diazinon (aryl), demethoate, malathion (alkyl), fenthion, parathion (aryl), trichlorfon (alkyl), runnel, abale, naled, chlorpyrifos, fenitrothion, dicapthon.
    • Carbamates: Carbaryl, dimetilan, propoxur, pyrolan.
    • Synthetic pyrethroids: Prothrin, resmethrin, bioresmethrin, permethrin, proparthin, tetramethrin
  • Stomach poisons: Paris green, sodium fluoride.
  • Fumigants: Hydrogen cyanide, methyl bromide, sulphur dioxide, carbon disulphide.
Specific Insecticides Comments
DDT (Dichloro-diphenyl-thrichloroethane) Insecticidal properties were discovered by Swiss scientist, Paul Muller. Most widely used insecticide. Attacks nerves of insects but doesn’t cause immediate death. White amorphous powder. Contains 70 – 80% of para-para isomers, which is the most active fraction of DDT. Has residual action up to 18 months. Used as a residual spray.Least toxic organo-chlorine compound.
HCH (hexachlorocyclo-hexane) Synthesized by Michael Faraday. Normal HCH contains 13 – 16% of gamma isomer. Gamma-HCH or lindane has 99% gamma isomer.Short residual action – 3 months.
Malathion Least toxicity of all organophosphorus compounds. Used as an ultra-low volume spray.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the usage of Paris green for mosquito control?

choices.text: Harmful in normal doses to man and animals

questions.solution:
Paris green is very effective against surface-feeding Anopheles.

It is an anti-larval measure and is a stomach poison. It is not harmful in normal doses to man and animals.

questions.text: Which of the following mosquitoes can be controlled by destroying aquatic plants with herbicides?
questions.solution:
Mansonia mosquitoes breed in water with aquatic vegetation, and destroying this vegetation with herbicides would control this mosquito.

Related Pearl: The Mosquito

The mosquito as a vector:

  • Mosquitoes are global in distribution
  • The main species of mosquitoes include the Anopheles, Culex, Aedes, and Mansonia
  • Flight range varies up to 11 km, except Aedes for which it is 100 meters
  • The life span of mosquitoes is around 8 to 34 days
  • Their morphology consists of a head with a proboscis, a pair of palpi, and a pair of antennae; a thorax and an abdomen
  • The larval stage lasts for 5 to 7 days

Characteristics:

Characteristics Anopheles Culex Aedes Mansonia

Eggs: 100-250. 

 Laid singly. Boat-shaped with lateral floats. Laid in clusters or rafts. Laid singly. Laid in star-shaped clusters.

Larval stage

No siphon tube.

Lies parallel to the undersurface of water.

Has siphon tube.

Lies in water with head faced downwards.

Has siphon tube.

Lies in water with head faced downwards.

Has siphon tube.

Lies in water with head faced downwards.
Adults Wings spotted. Wings unspotted. Wings unspotted. Striped body. Wings unspotted.
Breeding areas Clean water Dirty and polluted water Artificial collections of water Water bodies containing aquatic vegetation
Diseases Malaria, filaria Bancroftian filariasis, Japanese encephalitis, West Nile fever, viral arthritis. Yellow fever, dengue, DHF, chikungunya, rift valley fever, filariasis, Zika virus Malayan filariasis
Comments Anopheline mosquitoes tend to sit with their heads low and their rear ends raised high, especially when feeding. 

Called Nuisance mosquitoes

These culicine female mosquitoes keep their bodies horizontal while feeding.

Called tiger mosquitoes

Day biters

They get the tiger's name from the white stripes on its legs.

 Big, black, or brown mosquitoes with sparkling wings and legs. 

 

 

Culex mosquito keeps their bodies horizontal while feeding.

 Anopheles mosquito tends to sit at an angle, with their heads low and their rear ends raised high.

Aedes mosquito has a striped body pattern.

Related Pearl: Mosquito Control Measures

  • Anti-larval measures
    • Environmental control
      • This is done by source reduction by eliminating breeding places through appropriate methods for the different species.
      • Intermittent irrigation is also a method of environmental control
    • Chemical control
      • Mineral oils: Oldest known larvicidal method. Oils that are used are diesel oil, kerosene, crude oil fractions. Disadvantage is that it kills fish.
      • Paris green: Copper acetoarsenite is an emerald green, micro-crystalline powder and is insoluble in water. It is a stomach poison to larvae. It is not harmful to man or animals. Very effective against Anopheles as they are surface feeders.
      • Synthetic insecticides: Organo-phosphorous compounds like fenthion, chlorpyrifos and abate are larvicidal. Abate is least toxic.
    • Biological control
      • The fish species Gambusia affinis and Lebister reticulatus (Barbados millions) feed on mosquito larvae.
      • These are used in conjunction with other methods.
  • Anti-adult measures
    • Residual sprays
      • Adult mosquitoes can be controlled by spraying with residual insecticides like DDT, Malathion, propoxur and gamma-HCH (lindane)
      • Resistance to DDT has been shown by mosquitoes
    • Space sprays
      • Space sprays are those in which insecticides are sprayed into the atmosphere in the form of a mist or fog.
      • Pyrethrum is a contact, nerve poison and is the most common insecticide used as a space spray. Its active principle is pyrethrin.
      • Ultra-low volume space spraying (ULV) is done with Malathion and fenitrothion.
    • Genetic control by sterile male technique, cytoplasmic incompatibility, sex distortion, etc.
  • Protection against bites
    • Usage of mosquito nets, building screens and repellants like diethyltoluamide (deet), indalone, dimethylphthalate, dimethyl carbate, etc.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a mosquito anti-larval measure?
questions.solution:
Pyrethrum is an anti-adult measure and not an anti-larval measure.

Mineral oils, Gambusia, and Paris green are anti-larval measures used in mosquito control.

questions.text: Which among the following insecticides is most widely used as a space spray?
questions.solution:
The insecticide most widely used as a space spray is pyrethrum.

    • Carbamates: Carbaryl, dimetilan, propoxur, pyrolan.
    • Synthetic pyrethroids: Prothrin, resmethrin, bioresmethrin, permethrin, proparthin, tetramethrin
  • Stomach poisons: Paris green, sodium fluoride.
  • Fumigants: Hydrogen cyanide, methyl bromide, sulphur dioxide, carbon disulphide.

DDT (Dichloro-diphenyl-thrichloroethane) Insecticidal properties were discovered by Swiss scientist, Paul Muller. Most widely used insecticide. Attacks nerves of insects but doesn’t cause immediate death. White amorphous powder. Contains 70 – 80% of para-para isomers, which is the most active fraction of DDT. Has residual action up to 18 months. Used as a residual spray.Least toxic organo-chlorine compound.

questions.text:
Match the following methods of mosquito control to the appropriate examples.
Method of control Example
l.Biological control a.Larvicidal oil
ll.Genetic control b.Sex distortion
lll.Chemical control c.Source reduction
lV.Environmental control d.Barbados millions

choices.text: I – a, II – b, III – c, IV – d
I – b, II – d, III – c, IV – a
I – c, II – a, III – b, IV – d
I – d, II – b, III – a, IV – c

questions.solution:
The correctly matched methods of mosquito control are:

Method of control Example
Biological control Barbados millions
Genetic control Sex distortion
Chemical control Larvicidal oil
Environmental control Source reduction

Related Pearl: Mosquito Control Measures

  • Anti-larval measures
    • Environmental control
      • This is done by source reduction by eliminating breeding places through appropriate methods for the different species.
      • Intermittent irrigation is also a method of environmental control
    • Chemical control
      • Mineral oils: Oldest known larvicidal method. Oils that are used are diesel oil, kerosene, crude oil fractions. Disadvantage is that it kills fish.
      • Paris green: Copper acetoarsenite is an emerald green, micro-crystalline powder and is insoluble in water. It is a stomach poison to larvae. It is not harmful to man or animals. Very effective against Anopheles as they are surface feeders.
      • Synthetic insecticides: Organo-phosphorous compounds like fenthion, chlorpyrifos and abate are larvicidal. Abate is least toxic.
    • Biological control
      • The fish species Gambusia affinis and Lebister reticulatus (Barbados millions) feed on mosquito larvae.
      • These are used in conjunction with other methods.
  • Anti-adult measures
    • Residual sprays
      • Adult mosquitoes can be controlled by spraying with residual insecticides like DDT, Malathion, propoxur and gamma-HCH (lindane)
      • Resistance to DDT has been shown by mosquitoes
    • Space sprays
      • Space sprays are those in which insecticides are sprayed into the atmosphere in the form of a mist or fog.
      • Pyrethrum is a contact, nerve poison and is the most common insecticide used as a space spray. Its active principle is pyrethrin.
      • Ultra-low volume space spraying (ULV) is done with Malathion and fenitrothion.
    • Genetic control by sterile male technique, cytoplasmic incompatibility, sex distortion, etc.
  • Protection against bites
    • Usage of mosquito nets, building screens and repellants like diethyltoluamide (deet), indalone, dimethylphthalate, dimethyl carbate, etc.

questions.text: To curb an outbreak of plague in your locality, the municipal corporation decides to use rodenticides. Which of the following can be given as a single dose for this purpose?
questions.solution:
Zinc phosphide is a single-dose rodenticide that causes death in a one-time exposure.

Acute or single-dose rodenticides are classified according to the precautions that need to be taken before their use:

  • Those requiring ordinary care - Red squill, norbormide, zinc phosphide
  • Those requiring maximal precaution - Sodium fluoroacetate, fluoroacetamide and strychnine
  • Too dangerous for use - Arsenic trioxide, phosphorus, thallium sulphate

Multiple-dose or cumulative rodenticides cause death after multiple times of exposure. Examples include:

  • Warfarin
  • Coumafuryl
  • Diphacinone
  • Pindone

questions.text: Which of the following color labels is used to indicate the most hazardous pesticides?
questions.solution:
The most hazardous pesticides must have labels in red color.

Pesticide toxicity labels:

Category of Pesticide Color of Label
Extremely toxic Bright red
Highly toxic Bright yellow
Moderately toxic Bright blue
Slightly toxic Bright green

These labels are depicted in the image below.
